title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. This plan covers veterans enrolled in the annual patient enrollment system and survivors or dependents eligible for medical care. The Secretary will administer the plan through contracts with dental providers. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. The plan provides benefits for dental care and treatment, including diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services. Enrollment in the plan is voluntary for a minimum prescribed period, and premiums for coverage will be determined by the Secretary. The dental insurance plan under this section will have premiums set by the Secretary to cover all costs. Premiums will be adjusted annually, and individuals will be notified of any changes. Enrollees must pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment from the plan is permitted by the Secretary. The Secretary allows voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan within 30 days of enrollment and for specific circumstances that do not harm the plan's financial stability, such as relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction. The Secretary permits voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan within 30 days of enrollment for reasons like relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction or serious medical conditions. The Secretary will establish procedures for determining the permissibility of such disenrollments. This does not affect the Secretary's responsibility to provide dental care under section 1712 of this title. The dental insurance plan under this section is administered by the Secretary with regulations prescribed by them. The section terminates on December 31, 2021. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 17 of the title. Repeal of dental insurance plan for veterans and dependents under the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010.
